description: The United Nations Security Council condemned Rwanda for backing a rebellion in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo and ordered its troops to withdraw from the country.
title: UN Security Council Condemns Rwanda for Eastern Congo Violence

description: The Trump administration walked back cuts to a health program for 9/11 first responders and survivors, restoring research grants and the jobs of laid-off workers.
title: DOGE Restores 9/11 Survivor Program Cuts, Hiring Back Workers

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Returns to Conservative Conference as Party Weighs the Future

description: The Pentagon expects to fire between 5 and 8% of its civilian workforce, with the first round of layoffs targeting 5,400 probationary workers starting next week, according to a Defense Department statement.
title: Pentagon Expects to Fire Up to 8% of Its Civilian Workforce

description: Poland’s parliament on Friday approved a draft bill to partially suspend the right of asylum for some migrants as part of a crackdown on illegal crossings from neighboring Belarus.
title: Poland Suspends Some Asylum Rights to Suppress Illegal Crossings

description: The European Union is preparing a package of about €20 billion ($20.9 billion) in additional military support for Ukraine, according to a person familiar with the matter, as the bloc races to secure assistance for Kyiv in the face of President Donald Trump’s push to reach a quick peace settlement with Russia.
title: EU Is in Talks for €20 Billion Military Aid Package for Ukraine

description: Building America’s Future, a political group backed by billionaire Elon Musk, is planning to spend $1.6 million on ads to help elect a conservative lawyer to the state supreme court to replace a retiring liberal justice.
title: Musk-Funded PAC Books $1.6 Million in Ads to Sway Wisconsin High Court

description: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem says underlying price pressures may be cooler than indicated by the central bank’s two preferred measures of core inflation.
title: Bank of Canada’s Macklem Doubts Core Inflation Gauges, Pledges Review

description: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement is undergoing a shakeup with its acting director Caleb Vitello being moved to another post within the agency, the latest personnel change as President Donald Trump’s administration moves to ramp up deportations of undocumented migrants.
title: Trump’s Acting ICE Chief Sidelined in Latest Immigration Shakeup

description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass removed Fire Chief Kristin Crowley, citing failures in the department’s response to the devastating Palisades wildfire.
title: LA Mayor Bass Removes Fire Chief in Fallout From Palisades Blaze

description: Billionaire Steve Feinberg, the co-founder of Cerberus Capital Management who’s now a presidential nominee for a key role at the Pentagon, has a real estate empire that stretches beyond Manhattan to ranches in Colorado and upstate New York farms.
title: Billionaire Feinberg’s 1,827-Page Filing Reveals Property Empire

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government got backing from opposition parties including the Socialists to defeat a censure motion presented by far-right party Chega.
title: Portugal’s Premier Defeats Censure Motion With Opposition’s Help

description: A federal judge declined to immediately dismiss corruption charges against New York Mayor Eric Adams, instead appointing a prominent conservative lawyer to examine the Trump Justice Department’s move to drop the case.
title: Adams Judge Orders Probe of Trump DOJ Request to Drop Case

description: Turkey is still seeking to join BRICS nations as part of efforts to strengthen its economy, after decades of unsuccessful attempts to gain membership of the European Union, Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said.
title: EU Stalemate Fuels Turkish Ambition to Join BRICS, Minister Says

description: Pope Francis’ condition poses no immediate threat to his life though he remains at risk after a week in the hospital for treatment of pneumonia, doctors said.
title: Pope Francis Remains at Risk After a Week of Pneumonia Treatment

description: Latvian Prime Minister Evika Silina moved to replace three ministers and set out a new agenda for her coalition after tensions emerged within the three parties late last year.
title: Latvia Seeks to Ease Coalition Tension With Reshuffle

description: Russia doesn’t view sanctions relief as a critical factor in negotiations to end the war and isn’t expecting any significant easing of US penalties, according to a person close to the Kremlin.
title: Russia Is Unmoved by Trump’s Sanctions Threats and Offers on War

description: Polish President Andrzej Duda will travel to Washington Saturday to meet US President Donald Trump as the talks to end the war in Ukraine gather momentum, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: Polish President Duda to Meet Trump in US on Saturday

description: The top US energy regulatory agency will debate whether multibillion-dollar power auctions are still the best way to ensure sufficient electric supply amid a demand boom from artificial intelligence.
title: US Is Considering Scrapping Multibillion-Dollar Power Auctions

description: Cognac makers are urging the French government to engage in talks with China to resolve bilateral trade tensions that have led to monthly losses of €50 million ($52 million) for the industry.
title: Cognac Makers Losing Millions Urge Quick France-China Talks

description: France and Estonia will host a meeting of European defense ministers on Monday to discuss how to bolster support for Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: European Defense Chiefs to Hold Emergency Meeting on Ukraine

description: President Donald Trump said there was no need for President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to take part in talks on ending the conflict with Russia, keeping up his attacks on the Ukrainian leader.
title: Trump Says No Need to Include Ukraine’s Leader in Peace Talks

description: President Donald Trump said he is weighing a move that would absorb the US Postal Service, an independent agency, into the Department of Commerce, a sweeping change that comes as his administration looks to overhaul the US federal government.
title: Trump Says He’s Considering Merging Postal Service Into Commerce

description: The Philippines has been taken off a global watchdog’s dirty-money list, a move that could spur remittances and foreign investments in one of Asia’s fastest-growing economies.
title: Philippines Exits Global Watchdog’s Dirty Money ‘Gray List’

description: With US allies and rivals alike weathering a blizzard of daily announcements, insults and edicts from President Donald Trump, the rest of the world’s biggest economies did their best this week to show they were united.
title: G-20 Puts on Show of Unity Amid Trump’s Assault on Global Order

description: The hundreds of migrants from Asia and the Middle East deported to Central America by Donald Trump’s administration this week are among the first caught in a legal limbo that may take years to resolve.
title: US Puts Deportees in Limbo by Foisting Them on Its Neighbors

description: Luis Figo, Roberto Carlos and a host of other stars mark the inauguration of a new 45,000-seat stadium in Benghazi.
title: Football Greats Help a Libyan Warlord Showcase His Influence

description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign a memorandum Friday that opens the door to levies in response to digital services taxes some countries impose on US tech giants, people familiar with the plans said, the latest step to expand a tariff war aimed at addressing imbalances in global trade.
title: Trump Eyes Tariffs to Counter Digital Taxes Despised by Big Tech

description: A wave of strikes is set to hit Belgium’s rail network, with multiple trade unions planning walkouts that will disrupt transportation several times per month between late February and July.
title: Belgium Braces for Spate of Train Strikes Lasting Into Summer

description: US prosecutors and regulators are investigating a $32 million deal between CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. and a technology distributor to provide cybersecurity tools to the Internal Revenue Service, according to two people familiar with the matter and a document seen by Bloomberg News.
title: DOJ, SEC Investigating $32 Million CrowdStrike Deal With Carahsoft

description: The budget plan the Senate passed before dawn on Friday leaves large hurdles for President Donald Trump’s tax cut agenda and for raising the debt ceiling before a possible payments default in the summer.
title: Senate Budget Vote Leaves Hurdles For Trump Tax Cuts, Debt Limit

description: Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng expressed “serious concern” over new US tariffs in his first call with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent since Donald Trump returned to the White House, as the world’s two largest economies restart a high-level channel for communication.
title: China Raises Concern Over US Tariffs in First Call With Bessent

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico said he urged Elon Musk to stop the US imposing tariffs on Europe which could escalate into a full-blown transatlantic trade war.
title: Slovakia Seeks Musk’s Help to Avert Trade War Between US and EU

description: The leading party in Estonia’s government is polling its lowest in 21 years, as the consequences of the war in Ukraine weigh on the Baltic country’s struggling economy.
title: Estonia’s Leading Party Plummets in Polls as Economy Falters

description: An internet watchdog that identified participants in the Jan. 6 Capitol insurrection is preparing to cut staff. A media startup in Kosovo that hunts Russian disinformation has shuttered a weekly show amid a divisive political landscape. Privacy advocates are dialing back work in Iran that helps users in the Islamic Republic browse the web freely.
title: Trump’s Cuts at US Agencies Starve Internet Watchdogs That Fight Disinformation

description: A prolonged drought in Namibia has disrupted farming, leaving about 1.26 million people or more than 40% of the population at risk of crisis-level food insecurity, according to the nation’s agriculture ministry.
title: Drought Puts More than 40% of Namibians at Risk of Going Hungry

description: Ukrainian and US negotiators are seeking to move past the breakdown in transatlantic relations this week to finalize a deal on critical minerals, a person with knowledge of the talks said.
title: US, Ukraine Ramp Up Talks on Minerals Deal During Envoy Trip

description: A growing international consensus is emerging in favor of sanctions against Rwanda’s government over its role in the conflict in eastern Congo, the Belgian government said ahead of a key meeting of European foreign ministers next week.
title: Belgium Sees Growing Pressure for Sanctions on Rwanda Over War

description: India’s foreign minister met with his Chinese counterpart Friday, saying there’s been “some notable developments” made between the two nations in a bid to improve relations.
title: India Sees ‘Notable’ Progress With China as Ministers Meet (I)

description: A Ugandan court charged opposition leader Kizza Besigye with treason over an alleged plot to end President Yoweri Museveni’s four-decade rule of the East African nation.
title: Ugandan Court Charges Opposition Leader Besigye With Treason

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Squeezed by Trump and Putin, Denmark Spends Big on Defense

description: Firms have less ability to absorb costs, or bargain for special treatment, than bigger rivals.
title: Trump’s Tariff Wars Leave US Small Business With Nowhere to Hide

description: An axed custodian warns that the condition of the parks is “not going to be pretty.”
title: Trump Job Cuts Threaten Safety at National Parks, Workers Say

description: French Budget Minister Amelie de Montchalin criticized a bill adopted by the National Assembly for a 2% wealth tax, saying the measure — which is unlikely to become law — would hurt investment and job creation.
title: Wealth Tax Backed by French Lawmakers Is Panned by Government

description: President Donald Trump and his economic team are increasingly focusing on the revenues his tariffs would generate as he seeks to get tax cuts through Congress, pointing to an ominous path ahead for countries trying to avoid a trade war.
title: Trump’s Growing Focus on Tariff Revenue Raises Trade War Odds

description: US President Donald Trump has long said he would negotiate a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: What’s at Stake as Trump Sours on Ukraine’s Zelenskiy

description: Another subsea cable was ruptured offshore the Swedish island of Gotland in the Baltic Sea.
title: Sweden Reports Another Damaged Submarine Cable in Baltic Sea

description: Voters in Denmark, one of the biggest military donors to Ukraine, are in favor of sending peacekeepers to the country once the war is over, according to an opinion poll.
title: Danes in Favor of Sending Peacekeepers to Ukraine, Poll Shows

description: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered the military to intensify security operations in the West Bank following non-fatal bus bombings on Thursday night.
title: Israel to Step Up West Bank Operations After Bus Explosions

description: German conservative frontrunner Friedrich Merz pledged that a government under his leadership wouldn’t raise taxes to fund the hundreds of billions of euros of investment needed in areas like defense and infrastructure, saying it would be “poison” for Europe’s biggest economy.
title: Merz Rules Out Tax Increases If Conservatives Win Sunday’s Vote

description: The European Union and South Africa are forging closer ties after previous disagreements led to a frosty relationship, the bloc’s top diplomat said.
title: EU Bolsters Ties With South Africa as Nation Faces Trump’s Wrath

description: Chinese military vessels have held live-fire exercises off the coast of Australia in an escalation of tensions between the two countries, with commercial airlines warned by aviation authorities to avoid the area.
title: Chinese Warships Holds Live-Fire Military Exercises Off Australia Coast

description: Voter surveys gauging support for Germany’s political parties have proved relatively accurate in past elections and barely budged over the three-month campaign leading into Sunday’s ballot. Pollsters are still nervous there might be a surprise.
title: Germany’s Historically Accurate Pollsters Are Still a Bit Uneasy

description: Donald Trump’s administration is using freedom of speech as the latest line of attack on the European Union in a campaign that’s shaking the foundations of an alliance that stretches back to the dawn of the Cold War.
title: Trump Free Speech Attack on Europe Sets Up Big Tech Fight

description: Philippine authorities arrested more than 400 individuals during a raid of what they said was a Chinese-run offshore gaming operator in Manila, as the Southeast Asian nation intensifies its crackdown on scam centers.
title: Philippines Raids Chinese-Run Scam Center, Stepping Up Crackdown

description: President Donald Trump told Republican governors that implementing his agenda was key to their own political futures, arguing that embracing it could mitigate or even prevent losses in the midterm elections.
title: Trump Tells GOP Governors Their Political Futures Depend on Him

description: President Donald Trump warned Maine that he would block federal dollars from going to the state, saying it was letting transgender people compete in women’s sports.
title: Trump Threatens to Cut Maine Funds Over Transgender Sports Ban

description: The US Justice Department plans to formally dismiss a long-stalled administrative complaint accusing Elon Musk’s SpaceX of discriminating against refugees in hiring, according to a court filing.
title: US Seeks to Drop Stalled SpaceX Anti-Refugee Hiring Bias Case

description: The staffer with billionaire Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency who resigned after a report that linked him to racism and eugenics has been reinstated at the Social Security Administration, according to people familiar with the move.
title: DOGE Staffer Behind Racist Posts Reinstated at Social Security

description: Jennifer Granholm, who served as former President Joe Biden’s energy secretary, has been tapped to the board of Edison International, one of the US’s largest electric utility holding companies.
title: Biden’s Energy Secretary Granholm Joins Board of Big US Utility

description: A federal judge said the Trump administration failed to comply with his order to resume federal payments to foreign assistance programs administered by the US Agency for International Development, but he declined to hold the government in contempt as requested by groups that sued.
title: Judge Says Trump Administration Didn’t Follow His Funding Order
